title: Making sense of Bruins’ final roster cuts of training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins The Bruins made their final roster cuts on Sunday afternoon now that the preseason wrapped.
Matej Blumel was one of the final roster cuts during training camp.
Jonathan Wiggs/The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan October 6, 2025 | 4:26 PM 4 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Report: Patriots RB Antonio Gibson is out for the season with a torn ACL
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Gibson is the only player in the league with a kick return touchdown so far this season.

Antonio Gibson Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe Patriots running back Antonio Gibson is expected to miss the remainder of the season with a torn ACL after an MRI was performed on Monday, according to NFL Media’s Ian Rapoport.
Gibson left New England’s 23-20 win against Buffalo after being hit in the knee during a kick return in the second quarter.

title: Karen Read case: Judge drops one claim from wrongful death lawsuit, allows the rest
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The ruling dismisses a claim that Read negligently inflicted emotional distress on John O’Keefe’s teenage niece.

title: Phil Eng pushes back after Trump administration’s demand for info on T safety
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Transportation “Our work is never done, but the results are clear: we are delivering a safer, more reliable system for our riders,” Eng said.
MBTA General Manager Phil Eng.

Lane Turner/The Boston Globe, File By Abby Patkin October 6, 2025 | 1:25 PM 2 minutes to read Pushing back on federal transportation officials who recently questioned the MBTA’s safety, T General Manager Phil Eng said last week the agency has “made significant strides” to become safer and more reliable.

title: One killed, one injured in Jamaica Plain hit-and-run
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Police are continuing to search for the driver who fled the scene.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A driver fled the scene after they struck and killed one woman and critically injured another Sunday night in Jamaica Plain, officials said.

writer Ben Shattuck has more movies coming — including one directed by Ben Stiller.
